Nonforfeiture Benefit.value: Nonforfeiture Rider: provides benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or cancelled by insured; rider must be in effect for 3 years and when policy ends; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to the greater of total premiums paid or 1x MBA; available at initial application only

sources.snippet: Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or premiums or if cancelled by insured; rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; available at initial application only

Compound Inflation.value: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: increases MBA and remaining TBA by either 3% or 5% (options available)

sources.snippet: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year by either 3% or 5%, with corresponding increase in premium; coverage increases continue while insured is eligible;

Waiver of Premium.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

sources.snippet: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

Survivorship.value: Shared Care Rider: remaining TBA under deceased insured's policy is transferred to spouse/partner's policy at no extra cost; insured and spouse/partner can access each other's benefits once their own TBA exhausted

sources.snippet: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner** can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; when insured dies remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse/partner's policy at no extra cost;

Guaranteed Purchase Option.value: GPO (included with Simple Advantage only): insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years up to age 65 with no additional underwriting; lifetime max increase 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time; ends at earlier of policy anniversary after insured's 65th birthday or ineligibility

sources.snippet: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase based on attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; rider ends at earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday or when insured no longer eligible
GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

Indemnity Benefit.value: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available with this rider; benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

sources.snippet: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available with this rider; benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

Premium Refund at Death.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

sources.snippet: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

Cancellation.value: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse: limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment or insured's written cancellation after a substantial premium increase; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to greater of total premiums paid or 1x MBA; total benefits will not exceed TBA in effect immediately prior to nonforfeiture date

sources.snippet: Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to nonforfeiture date

INTERNATIONAL_BENEFIT.snippet: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to lesser of (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

PAYMENT_OPTIONS.snippet: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider 	6 available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO;

reasoningNotes: Preserved the provided elimination period skeleton value (100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative) since it is present in the extraction with confidence 0.8.

Populated Benefit Type, MBA and TBA, inflation options, GPO, Cash Benefit Rider, Nonforfeiture wording, premium payment options, and coordination/care coordination items directly from extraction fields. Many of these come from page 1 with lower OCR confidence (0.6) - flagged with lower confidence.
Bed reservation information lists days and 'actual charges' but does not specify a per-day dollar amount; recorded accordingly.
Initial Needs Assessment explicitly states EP not required for that single visit; recorded as an EP exemption.

Many typical LTC specifics (ADL trigger language, exact ADL list definitions, DME, home modifications, respite details, therapeutic equipment rental specifics, prescription drug coverage, restoration of benefits, extension of benefits, renewal premium specifics) are not present in the extraction and therefore left null per instructions.
Where multiple fields provided overlapping information (e.g., home/community care and facility care), entries were consolidated and sources for each statement are provided.
Confidence reflects original OCR/extraction confidence: 0.8 for most page-2 feature table items and 0.6 for page-1 plan table/rider items. No Azure Search snippets were available.
